title: FC Argeș 1953 Pitești
text:
Fotbal Club Argeș 1953 Pitești was a Romanian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club from <a href="Pite%C8%99ti">Pitești</a>, <a href="Arge%C8%99%20County">Argeș</a>. It was founded in 2013 as a <a href="Phoenix%20club%20%28association%20football%29">phoenix club</a> of the then-dissolved team <a href="FC%20Arge%C8%99%20Pite%C8%99ti">FC Argeș Pitești</a>, and was fully owned by its supporters.
History.
Liga IV Argeș County (2014–present).
After the dissolution of the original team <a href="FC%20Arge%C8%99%20Pite%C8%99ti">FC Argeș Pitești</a>, the supporters recreated the team and named it FC Argeș 1953, a phoenix club who started in <a href="Liga%20IV">Liga IV</a>. In their first season they finished on the second place in <a href="Liga%20IV%20Arge%C8%99">Liga IV – Argeș County</a>. In the same year they participated in the first ever Football without Owners Tournament, a new established trophy for the fan-owned phoenix clubs in <a href="Romania">Romania</a>, the other participants was <a href="ASU%20Politehnica%20Timi%C8%99oara">ASU Politehnica Timișoara</a>, <a href="FC%20Vaslui">FC Vaslui 2002</a> and the host <a href="LSS%20Voin%C8%9Ba%20Sibiu">LSS Voința Sibiu</a>, they finished on the third place at the event. On June 12, they managed to win against the county rivals <a href="ACS%20Unirea%20Bascov">Unirea Bascov</a> to win the league and qualify in the promotion play-off to <a href="Liga%20III">Liga III</a>.
After the promotion the club was dissolved, not having enough financial support.
Honours.
Domestic.
<a href="Liga%20IV%20Arge%C8%99">Liga IV – Argeș County</a>
